text: the fact is that many of the most
important agricultural

we have confronted problems of scarcity
in the past
and we have always figured out ways to
manage them
those ways have always encompassed
this use of price signals to send
messages about scarcity to producers and
to consumers
so if we get into trouble it will be
because we are unwilling to allow
price signals to signal that scarcity
right if we pretend that things are free
we will use too much of them if we
pretend that the atmosphere has an
infinite ability to absorb carbon
dioxide we will overuse that ability and
we will
bring about changes that will be
difficult for us to manage
it's not impossible if we misprice water
we will use too much of it
and we will run ourselves into

to do

so that the farmers who are enormously
innovative people
